A previous 195 study reported HMPV was responsible for approximately 5-10% of hospitalizations in 196 children suffering from ARI, 14 creating a considerable clinical and economic burden 197 worldwide. HMPV detection rates vary according to geographic location, and the 198 incidence of HMPV may show seasonal or annual patterns in the same area. In 199 previous studies, 21330 HMPV was detected in approximately 1%-17% of ARI cases. In 200 this 3 year study, 103 of 5133 (2.0%) patients were positive for HMPV, which is similar 201 to previous reports of HMPV in patients with ARI in southern China 31 and Japan. 32 202 Children under 5 years of age are most susceptible to HMPV infection, and 203 those younger than 2 years of age are at the greatest risk of developing serious 204conditions. 15 In our study, HMPV3positive cases appeared more frequently in patients 205 which is consistent with many previous studies. 3 30 33 34 Specifically, HMPV prevalence 207 was highest in children >1-2 years (2.8%, 21/752). This may be explained by the 208 immunity against HMPV, which is passed down from mother3to3child, gradually 209 subsiding over time. Moreover, children were more contact with outside world as they 210 grew older. Therefore, children of this age need more attention to prevent HMPV 211 infection. Moreover, our findings suggested no difference in risk between sex, there 212 was no significant difference in the HMPV prevalence between male and female 213 patients ( =0.771), which is consistent with previous studies.35  36 214 Page 12 of 35 For peer review only -http://bmjopen.bmj.com/site/about/guidelines.xhtml HMPV has a typical seasonal distribution. HMPV activity is largely affected by 215 different local climate factors. The prevalence of HMPV in temperate climates peaks 216 at the end of winter or in early spring. 37 38 In our study, seasonal peaks of HMPV were 217 detected in February 2016, March 2014 and May 2015. This finding indicates that 218 HMPV circulates primarily during the spring and early summer in Guangzhou, this 219 pattern is similar to previous reports from other subtropical areas. 22 39 Furthermore, we 220 also found small peaks in November 2014, September 2015, and May 2016, the 221 reason for this is unknown. It should be noted that the seasonal distribution of HMPV 222 overlaps with RSV in this geographical area. 19 Knowing the epidemiological 223 characteristics of HMPV will help public health authorities and clinicians to improve 224 strategies for controlling HMPV infection. 225 HMPV co3infection with other respiratory pathogens has been reported in 226 many studies, including RSV, 40 InfA, 41 InfB, 42 PIV, 43 ADV, 43 44 HBoV, 45 HCoV , 43 46 227 HRV, 43 EV, 43 MP, 41 and CP. 41 In our study, most HMPV3positive patients only had 228 HMPV (81.6%, 84/103), and there was no significant difference in the HMPV 229 prevalence according to sex between the patients with only HMPV detected and the 230 patients with HMPV plus other pathogen(s) detected ( =0.469). The co3detection rate 231 was 18.4% (19/103), and RSV (36.8%, 7/19) was the most frequently co3detected 232 pathogen, which might be because of the overlapping seasonal distribution of these 233 two pathogens. 47 Co3detection rates of HCoV3OC43, MP, HBoV, ADV, HRV, InfA, PIV2, 234 and PIV3 were over 5%, suggesting a broad range of respiratory pathogens could 235 co3exist with HMPV in ARI pediatric patients. The clinical 237 manifestations of HMPV3positive patients are similar to those of RSV3positive patients, 238 especially in young children. 48350 In previous studies, the most frequent diagnoses of 239 children hospitalized with HMPV infection were pneumonitis and bronchiolitis. 3 51 52 In 240 some studies, bronchiolitis and recurrent wheezing/pneumonia were the main clinical 241 diagnoses, 7 22 53 54 while in other studies, bronchopneumonia, bronchiolitis, and 242 bronchial asthma exacerbation were the main clinical diagnoses. 34 Our study showed 243 that 66.7% (56/84), 9.5% (8/84) and 13.1% (11/84) of HMPV3positive patients were 244 diagnosed with bronchopneumonia, bronchiolitis, and pneumonia by chest 245 radiography, respectively.
